Referenced on 01.20.2016 | population_total = 75 415 | population_as_of = January, 2016 | population_density_km2 = auto |government_type = Region of Finland |leader_title1 = Regional Mayor |leader_name1 = Pentti Malinen |leader_title2 = Chairman of the Regional Assembly |leader_name2 = Pentti Kettunen |leader_title3 = Chairman of the Regional Board |leader_name3 = Timo Korhonen | timezone1 = EET | utc_offset1 = +2 | timezone1_DST = EEST | utc_offset1_DST = +3 | blank_name_sec1 = NUTS | blank_info_sec1 = 134 | blank_name_sec2 = Regional bird | blank_info_sec2 = Siberian jay (Perisoreus infaustus) | blank1_name_sec2 = Regional fish | blank1_info_sec2 = European smelt (Osmerus eperlanus) | blank2_name_sec2 = Regional flower | blank2_info_sec2 = Heather (Calluna vulgaris) | blank3_name_sec2 = Regional Stone | blank3_info_sec2 = Greenschist | blank4_name_sec2 = Regional lake | blank4_info_sec2 = Oulujärvi | blank5_name_sec2 = Regional song | blank5_info_sec2 = Nälkämaan laulu | iso_code = FI-05 | website = www.kainuu.fi | footnotes = }} Kainuu is a region in eastern Finland. As of January 2015, there were about 75 000 people living there. It is next to Northern Ostrobothnia, Northern Savonia and North Karelia. Kainuu is a multi-cultural area.Sotkan maa - Sotkamo, Alpo Komulainen 001 1 398 page 7 == Municipalities == Kainuu has 8 municipalities of which two are cities (marked bold). The population is displayed on the right side of the municipal names. In the early 2016 the municipality of Vaala became part of the region of Northern Ostrobothnia.Vaala siirtyy Kainuusta Pohjois-Pohjanmaahan vuoden 2016 alusta Press release. Ministry of Finance.
